H0.text: Root is the part of a plant that takes in water and nutrients from the soil.

H1.text: The stem is the part of a plant that takes in water and nutrients from the soil.

H2.text: Flower is the part of a plant that takes in water and nutrients from the soil.

H3.text: Leaf is the part of a plant that takes in water and nutrients from the soil.

A4.text: The leaves draw water from the ground in the transpiration stream through a vascular conducting system known as xylem

A5.text: Xylem: Cells that bring water and minerals from the roots into the leaf
